pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Linux systems normally send all interrupts (IRQs) to one CPU, unless they are explicitly farmed out to other CPUs. This package, irqbalance-novena, takes care of distributing the interrupt load among all available processors on the Novena single board computer.
It is a fork of v0.56, because newer versions rely on x86-specific bits that are not present on ARM.
Running irqbalance will improve performance. Notably, audio stutters much less when running irqbalance.
